description:
At the expense of the people and things around her, Sakura has absorbed so much "happiness energy" that she has caused an energy imbalance in the world. In order to return balance to the world, the Poverty God, Momiji, sets out to take away Sakura's ability to absorb this energy. Will Momiji be able to put a stop to Sakura's absorbing abilities, or will the God succumb to her happiness?

(Source: FUNimation)

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Body Swapping
tags.description: Centers around individuals swapping bodies with one another.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

node.description: PIKO is a Japanese singer. He is a popular singer on Nico Nico Douga, a Japanese video sharing site. He is called a “Ryoseirui”, which means that he has the range and tone of both a male and female. He debuted as an indie singer in 2007 when he uploaded a cover of Hatsune Miku's Melt onto Nico Nico Douga. He signed with Ki/oon Records, a subsidary of Sony, in 2010 and will now face the challenge of being a major singer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/58120205)

Originating from [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/).

He first came to prominence as the director who overtook [Shinji Takamatsu](https://anilist.co/staff/100152/) on [Gintama](https://anilist.co/anime/918/) from episode 100 onwards. He stepped down from the role after the [2013 movie](https://anilist.co/anime/15335/), but remained as a supervisor for the series until the end.

Also known for series such as [Osomatsu-san](https://anilist.co/anime/21261/) and [Binbougami ga!](https://anilist.co/anime/13535/).

Masashi Hamauzu is a Japanese video game composer who was employed at Square Enix from 1996 to 2010. He is best known for his work on the Final Fantasy and SaGa series. Born into a musical family in Germany, Hamauzu was raised in Japan. He became interested in music while in kindergarten, and got piano lessons from his parents.    Hamauzu was hired by Square (now Square Enix) as a trainee, and his debut as a solo composer came the following year when he scored Chocobo no Fushigina Dungeon. He has collaborated with his friend and fellow composer Junya Nakano on several games, and has worked closely with synthesizer programmer Ryo Yamazaki on most titles since SaGa Frontier 2.    After Nobuo Uematsu left Square Enix in 2004, Hamauzu took over as the leading composer of the company's music team. He was the sole composer for Final Fantasy XIII. He has also become a renowned piano arranger, and has arranged a number of albums, including Yasunori Mitsuda's Sailing to the World piano score in 2006. His music incorporates various styles, although he mostly uses classical and ambient music in his pieces. In 2010, Hamauzu left Square Enix to start his own studio, Monomusik.
Joined Audio Planning U in 1982, where he studied under [Yasuo Urakami](https://anilist.co/staff/111277/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/marchimark) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/jamiemarchi/)

An American voice actress, ADR director, and script writer who works for Funimation and Sentai Filmworks. She grew up in Oklahoma and graduated from the University of Oklahoma with a bachelor's degree in theater, starting her professional acting career in 2000. She married fellow actor Sean T. Perez on August 8, 1999, and they divorced on November 21, 2005. Jamie has two step-daughters. Her younger half-brother, [Jean-Luc Hester](https://anilist.co/staff/104094), is also a voice actor.

Itaoka Nishiki is an animator that last worked on Studio Live.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Itaoka1)

The founder and former representative director of [Funimation](https://anilist.co/studio/102/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Policeman in "Chuck E. Cheese in the Galaxy 5000"

__Cousin:__ [Aaron Dismuke](https://anilist.co/staff/95254/Aaron-Dismuke)

__Justin Ryan Cook__ is an American voice actor, producer, line producer, ADR director and enginner who works for FUNimation.
